metadata.title: CVE-2023-52768 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:wifi: wilc1000: use vmm_table as array in wilc structEnabling KASAN and running some iperf tests raises some memory issues withvmm_table:BUG: KASAN: slab-out-of-bounds in wilc_wlan_handle_txq+0x6ac/0xdb4Write of size 4 at addr c3a61540 by task wlan0-tx/95KASAN detects that we are writing data beyond range allocated to vmm_table.There is indeed a mismatch between the size passed to allocator inwilc_wlan_init, and the range of possible indexes used later: allocationsize is missing a multiplication by sizeof(u32)

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
